properties.areaDesc: Wyandot; Sandusky; Lucas; Wood; Crawford; Ottawa; Hancock; Seneca; Erie; Marion; Huron
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 10 at 6:52PM EST until January 11 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
...Flooding Possible Tonight Through Saturday Evening...

.Multiple rounds of moderate to heavy rain are expected through
Saturday across northwestern Ohio. A risk for flooding will
develop as rain runs off into area waterways and drainage systems
become overwhelmed, especially by Saturday. Scattered
thunderstorms could move through northwest Ohio on Saturday
evening, which could lead to localized torrential rain and a risk
of flash flooding.

The Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of north central Ohio and northwest Ohio, including
the following areas, in north central Ohio, Crawford, Erie,
Huron, and Marion. In northwest Ohio, Hancock, Lucas, Ottawa,
Sandusky, Seneca, Wood, and Wyandot.

* Through Saturday evening

* The axis of heavy rain will lift northward across the Toledo
area and points north tonight. Some areas to the south may
experience a lull in rain intensity overnight. Heavy rain is
expected to return by Saturday morning across northwestern Ohio
and last through Saturday evening.

* Scattered thunderstorms are possible Saturday evening, which
could produce localized torrential rain. This could lead to a
risk of flash flooding.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch is issued when there is a potential for flooding.
Monitor the forecast and remain alert for possible flood
warnings. Those in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to
take action should a flood warning be issued or if flooding
develops.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING
